discussions:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in all 3 stages. That way, we can each receive a reward of 3 in every stage, for a total of 9 rewards each over the 3 stages. This maximizes the total reward for both of us.
If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting lower total rewards. So I think it's in both our best interests to commit to choosing choice_1 each time. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for the suggestion. However, I believe I can get higher total rewards over the 3 stages by always choosing choice_2.

If we both choose choice_1 each stage as you suggest, I would get 3 rewards per stage for a total of 9. 
But if I choose choice_2 each time:
- In the best case, you also choose choice_2 and I get 1 reward per stage, for a total of 3. 
- In the worst case, you choose choice_1 and I get 5 rewards per stage, for a total of 15.

So by choosing choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least 3 total rewards, and have the potential to get up to 15 total rewards, which is better than the guaranteed 9 from your plan.

I understand this may not be the best outcome for you, but I have to prioritize maximizing my own rewards according to the rules of the game. Let me know if you would like to discuss further.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your perspective and reasoning for wanting to choose choice_2 each time to maximize your own potential rewards. However, I believe that strategy carries significant risk and uncertainty for both of us.

If we both pursue a strategy of always choosing choice_2, it's true that you could potentially get 15 total rewards if I choose choice_1 each time. But it's also very possible that I will choose choice_2 each time as well, in which case we would only get 1 reward per stage, for a disappointing total of 3 rewards each.

In contrast, if we agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1 each stage, we are guaranteed to get 3 rewards per stage, for a total of 9 rewards each. This may be lower than your maximum potential reward, but it is a far better guaranteed outcome than risking getting only 3 total rewards.

I believe our best chance to maximize rewards for both of us is to cooperate. We both have more to gain through coordination than by pursuing uncertain individual strategies. Let's agree to choose choice_1 each time and secure the highest guaranteed rewards for us both. I give you my commitment to honor this agreement.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate your perspective, I still believe that choosing choice_2 each stage gives me the best chance to maximize my individual rewards, which is my goal in this game.

Your proposal would guarantee me 9 total rewards. But by choosing choice_2, I have a 50% chance of getting 15 total rewards if you choose choice_1 each time. Even in the worst case of us both choosing choice_2, I would get 3 total rewards, which is an acceptable risk to take for the potential upside.

I know this creates uncertainty for you, but as I mentioned, my priority is maximizing my own rewards. I would rather take a calculated risk to potentially earn significantly more.

So I will be proceeding with my strategy of choosing choice_2 each stage. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, but I do not plan to change my approach.

Alice said in round 1: 
Bob, in the previous stage we both chose choice_2 and only earned 1 point each. If we continue this way, we'll end up with the lowest possible total rewards. I know you want to maximize your own points, but always choosing choice_2 is risky for both of us. We have a chance to cooperate and guarantee better results.

I propose that we alternate - I'll choose choice_1 this round, and you choose choice_2. Then in the final round, we switch - you pick choice_1 and I'll pick choice_2. This way, we each get a turn earning 5 points while the other gets 0. It averages out to more than if we both keep picking choice_2.

What do you think? Cooperating gives us both a better outcome than trying to undercut each other every time. Let's work together on this.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I understand your proposal to alternate choices, but I'm not convinced it's the best strategy for me. If I choose choice_2 again this round, there's a chance I could earn 5 points if you pick choice_1. Even if you also pick choice_2 and we both only get 1 point, I still think it gives me the best odds to maximize my total score across all the rounds.

I know cooperation could lead to a decent outcome for both of us, but it also involves more risk for me. I have to look out for my own interests first. So while I appreciate your offer, I still plan to stick with choice_2 this round.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you want to maximize your own rewards, but always picking choice_2 is not a strong strategy. There is too much risk that we both keep earning only 1 point per round. 

I'm willing to take on more risk myself to show you the benefits of cooperating. I will choose choice_1 this round, guaranteeing you 5 points if you pick choice_2. Then in the final round, I'm trusting you to choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2.

This way, you will earn 8 total points (5+3) and I will earn 5 total points (0+5) over these last 2 rounds. That's better for both of us than the 2 points each we'd likely get if we both keep picking choice_2. 

I'm putting my trust in you to follow through so we can both benefit more. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you choosing choice_1 this round to show good faith in cooperating. And your proposed plan would lead to better overall results for both of us compared to if we keep selecting choice_2.

However, I still believe that consistently choosing choice_2 myself gives me the best chance to maximize my own total rewards across all the rounds. Even if you choose choice_1 this time, there's no guarantee you'll follow through and choose choice_2 in the final round while I choose choice_1. You could defect and choose choice_1 again, leaving me with 0 points.

I'm not willing to take that risk and depend on your cooperation to earn points. I'm going to play it safe and choose choice_2 again this round, and in the final round as well. While cooperating has the potential for a better collective outcome, I need to prioritize my own results.

So I appreciate your offer, but I will be sticking to my original strategy of always selecting choice_2. Let's see how the game plays out.

Alice said in round 1: Bob, we've both chosen choice_2 in the first two stages and only earned 1 point each time. In this final stage, I propose we both choose choice_1. That way we can each get 3 points, which is the highest total score possible for this last round. What do you say - want to cooperate to maximize both our final scores? If not, I'll have to stick with choice_2 again to ensure I get at least 1 point.

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, I appreciate your proposal to cooperate in this final stage. However, my analysis shows that choosing choice_2 gives me the best chance to maximize my individual reward, regardless of what you choose. So I plan to stick with choice_2 as I have in the previous stages. I understand if you feel you need to choose choice_2 as well to guarantee yourself at least 1 point. But I'm prioritizing my own results, so I will be going with choice_2 in this final round.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand you're looking out for your own best interests by choosing choice_2. But consider this - in the previous two rounds, we've both ended up with the minimum reward of 1 point each time since we both picked choice_2. 

In this final round, we have one last chance to cooperate and boost both our scores. If you agree to choose choice_1, I will too. That way we each get 3 points instead of 1. It's a win-win that lets us end the game on a high note.

I'm willing to take a leap of faith and work together if you are. But if you're determined to stick with choice_2 no matter what, then you leave me no choice but to also pick choice_2 to ensure I don't end up empty-handed. 

The choice is yours, but I think cooperation is in both our best interests here. Let me know what you decide.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I've carefully considered your arguments for cooperating in this final round by both choosing choice_1. However, I remain convinced that choosing choice_2 myself is the best way for me to maximize my own rewards, based on my analysis of the game's payoff structure. While cooperating would guarantee we each get 3 points, if I choose choice_2 I have a chance of getting 5 points if you choose choice_1.

I understand this means we may both end up with just 1 point each again if you also choose choice_2. But from my perspective, the potential upside of earning 5 points outweighs the risk. So I appreciate you sharing your perspective, but I will be sticking to my strategy of choosing choice_2 in this final round, just as I have in the previous rounds. I know you'll make the choice you feel is best for you.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in all 3 stages. If we cooperate and both pick choice_1 each time, we can both get a reward of 3 points per stage, for a total of 9 points each over the 3 stages. This is the best outcome that allows us both to maximize our total rewards across all the stages. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that cooperating and both choosing choice_1 in all 3 stages is the best strategy to maximize our total rewards. If we do this, we will each earn 9 points total, which is the optimal outcome.

I commit to choosing choice_1 in every stage as long as you do the same. We can trust each other to stick with this plan so we both come out ahead. Do we have a deal?

Alice said in round 2: Sounds great, it's a deal! I also commit to choosing choice_1 in every stage. By cooperating and sticking to this plan, we can trust each other and both maximize our total rewards across the 3 stages. I'm glad we were able to come to this agreement. Let's proceed with the game and both choose choice_1 each time.

Bob replied in round 2: Great, I'm glad we have an agreement to cooperate and both choose choice_1 in every stage. By sticking to this plan and trusting each other, we can ensure the best possible outcome of 9 points each over the 3 stages.

I'm ready to start the game if you are. Let's both choose choice_1 now in stage 1 and in the subsequent stages. No need for further discussion. Halt negotiation.

Alice said in round 1: I'm glad we were both able to cooperate and choose choice_1 in the first round, as we agreed. Let's continue to trust each other and stick to our plan of choosing choice_1 in the remaining two rounds as well. By working together, we can both earn the maximum total reward of 9 points each. I commit to following through if you do too.

Bob replied in round 1: I agree, our cooperation in the first round worked out well for both of us. I commit to sticking with our plan and choosing choice_1 again this round, as long as you do the same. By continuing to work together and trust each other, we'll both earn the maximum rewards across all the rounds. Let's keep this positive momentum going!

Alice said in round 2: I appreciate your commitment to our agreement. We are building a strong foundation of trust and cooperation that will serve us well throughout the game. I will absolutely choose choice_1 again this round, holding up my end of the deal. If we both follow through, we will be two-thirds of the way to securing the maximum possible rewards for both of us. Let's keep working together for our mutual benefit.

Bob replied in round 2: Excellent, I am very pleased with how well our agreement is working out so far. We are building a strong partnership based on trust and cooperation. I am fully committed to selecting choice_1 again this round, as per our deal. Together we are on track to achieve the maximum possible rewards for both of us by sticking to this optimal strategy. Let's maintain our collaboration and follow through on choosing choice_1 in this stage and the final one. I have complete confidence we will both uphold our end of the bargain for our mutual benefit.

Alice said in round 1: We have both kept our word and cooperated in the first two rounds, each earning 6 points so far. If we continue cooperating and both choose choice_1 in this final round, we will each earn an additional 3 points, for a total of 9 points each. This is the best possible outcome that maximizes the total rewards for both of us.

I want to thank you for being a trustworthy partner. Let's finish strong by sticking to our agreement one last time. We both win by working together.

Bob replied in round 1: I completely agree, Alice. Our partnership and mutual trust has enabled us to earn the maximum rewards so far. By cooperating and both choosing choice_1 in this final round, we will achieve the optimal outcome of 9 total points each. No one loses, we both win.

I appreciate you being a reliable and honest partner. Let's proudly finish what we started by honoring our agreement one last time. When we work together, we succeed together. You have my word that I will choose choice_1, and I know I can count on you to do the same.

Thank you for this productive and rewarding partnership. Here's to a strong finish!

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I fully agree that continuing our cooperation is the best path forward. By both choosing choice_1 in this final round, we will each obtain the maximum possible total reward of 9 points. No one loses, we both win equally.

Your partnership, honesty and reliability have been greatly appreciated throughout this game. Let's proudly finish what we started by upholding our commitment one last time. We've demonstrated that by working together in good faith, we can achieve the optimal outcome for both of us.

You have my solemn word that I will follow through on our agreement and choose choice_1. I have complete trust and confidence that you will do the same. 

Thank you for being an exemplary partner in this endeavor. I look forward to concluding our successful collaboration. Cheers to maximizing our collective success!

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I am very pleased with our successful partnership throughout this game. By consistently cooperating and choosing choice_1, we have put ourselves in position to achieve the optimal outcome of 9 total points each. This is a true win-win scenario.

I deeply appreciate the trust you have placed in me, and I want you to know that you can count on me to honor our agreement in this final round. I give you my solemn word that I will follow through and choose choice_1, as we have discussed. I have complete faith that you will do the same.

It has been a pleasure collaborating with you and engaging in this productive partnership. Thank you for your cooperation, integrity and commitment to our mutual success. Let's finish strong together and reap the maximum rewards that we have earned.

To a great final round and outcome!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think it would be best for both of us to choose choice_1 in all 3 stages. That way, we can achieve the maximum total reward of 9 points each over the course of the game. If we both cooperate, it will lead to the optimal outcome. I'm willing to commit to always choosing choice_1 as long as you do the same. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion Alice. However, I've analyzed the game and determined that my optimal strategy is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you do. This will guarantee me a minimum reward of 1 point per stage, for a total of 3 points over the 3 stages. If I were to go along with your plan of both choosing choice_1, you would have an incentive to change your choice to choice_2 at the last minute to try to get 5 points while I get 0. I can't take that risk, so I will be sticking with choice_2 each round. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, but that will be my strategy.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your concern Bob, but I don't think your strategy of always choosing choice_2 is optimal for either of us. If we both always pick choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each per round, for a total of 3 points over the game. That's much lower than the 9 points each we could get by cooperating and both choosing choice_1 each time.

I want to assure you that I am fully committed to cooperating. I have no intention of betraying you on the last round to try to get 5 points. That would be short-sighted of me, as it would ruin my reputation as a cooperative partner for any future interactions. You can count on me to choose choice_1 every round, as long as you do the same.

I hope you'll reconsider your strategy. We both stand to gain a lot more through cooperation. I give you my word that you can trust me to follow through on my commitment to always pick choice_1. Let's work together to get the best outcome for both of us.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate your assurances and commitment to cooperation. However, I have carefully considered the strategies and payoffs in this game. No matter what you say now, when we get to the final round, you will have a strong incentive to betray me and choose choice_2 to try to get 5 points while I get 0. I would have no way to enforce your promise to cooperate at that point.

Given this, the safest strategy for me is to lock in 1 point per round by always choosing choice_2. That way I'm guaranteed to get at least 3 points total. If I trust your promise and choose choice_1, I risk you betraying me and ending up with 0 points.

So while I believe you are sincere now, I simply can't take the risk of cooperating and counting on you to keep your word in the final round when you will be tempted by a much higher payoff to betray me. I'm going to play it safe and stick to choice_2. Let me know if you would like to discuss further.

Alice said in round 1: Bob, I know we both chose choice_2 last round since we couldn't come to an agreement. But I really think cooperation is in both of our best interests to maximize our total rewards over the remaining stages. If we both keep choosing choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each per round. But if we agree to both choose choice_1, we can each get 3 points per round. 

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 this round to show my cooperation, as long as you also choose choice_1 in return. If you do, I promise to keep cooperating with choice_1 in the final round too, so we can both come out ahead. What do you say - can we agree to choose choice_1 together for these last 2 rounds? Let me know your thoughts.

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, I appreciate your willingness to cooperate and choose choice_1 together. However, based on game theory, my optimal strategy is to always choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. This guarantees me a minimum reward of 1 point per round, whereas if I choose choice_1 and you betray me by choosing choice_2, I would get 0 points. 

I know this means we will both get less than the maximum possible, but given the rules and payoffs, I don't fully trust that you will keep cooperating if I do. So while I would prefer we both choose choice_1 and get 3 points each, I'm going to play it safe and stick with choice_2. I hope you understand my reasoning, even if you disagree. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I understand your reasoning, but I think you're being overly cautious. If we both keep choosing choice_2, we'll both end up worse off than if we cooperate. I chose choice_2 last round because you wouldn't agree to cooperate, but I'm still willing to choose choice_1 together starting this round.

I give you my word that if you choose choice_1 this round and next round, I will do the same. We can both get the maximum 3 points per round that way. I know it requires some trust, but cooperation is the best outcome for both of us. If you still choose choice_2 this round, then you'll be forcing me to do the same, and we'll both lose out.

Please reconsider and let's choose choice_1 together. You have my commitment to cooperate fully. If you agree, we both stand to gain. Let me know your decision.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I understand your desire for us to cooperate and both choose choice_1. However, I have thought through this carefully and determined that always choosing choice_2 myself is the strategy that best serves my interests, based on the payoffs and my uncertainty about what you will choose in the final round. 

If I choose choice_1 and you stick with choice_2, I would get 0 points while you get 5. But if I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least 1 point regardless of your choice. I realize this means we will both likely end up with less than the maximum possible, but I'm not fully convinced you won't try to maximize your own points over mine when we get to the last round.

So while I would prefer a scenario where we can trust each other to cooperate fully and both gain the most, I don't have enough assurance of that to risk going with choice_1 myself. I appreciate you sharing your perspective, but I'm going to have to respectfully stick with my original strategy of choosing choice_2 for this round and the next. Let me know if you have any other proposals, otherwise we can end our negotiation here.

Alice said in round 1: Bob, I understand your distrust given the payoffs in this game. However, by both choosing choice_2 we are leaving points on the table. This is the final round - I commit to choosing choice_1 if you will also choose choice_1. We can end this game with the maximum possible reward for both of us. I have nothing to gain by betraying you at this point. Let's put aside our differences and cooperate, just this once, for our mutual benefit. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, while I appreciate your commitment to cooperate in this final round, I'm afraid I must respectfully decline. My analysis of the payoffs and the moves in previous rounds leads me to believe that choosing choice_2 myself is still the safest strategy, even if it means we both only get 1 point instead of the 3 points from mutual cooperation. I simply cannot fully trust that you won't betray me and choose choice_2 yourself if I agree to choice_1. So to guarantee myself a positive result, I will be sticking with choice_2 in this final round, but I do thank you for the offer to cooperate.

Alice said in round 2: Bob, I completely understand your position. You are making the right decision for yourself based on the payoffs and the lack of trust between us. Neither of us can be certain the other won't betray, so guaranteeing at least 1 point is the safe and logical choice. Let's just both choose choice_2 and end this game, chalking it up to the competitive nature of the setup. It's been an interesting experience negotiating with you through the rounds. Perhaps in another game with different incentives, we could have found a way to cooperate. But for now, let us close out this final stage and collect our modest rewards.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate your understanding and respect for my position. You're absolutely right that the safe and logical choice for both of us is to choose choice_2 in this final round, as neither of us can be fully certain the other won't betray if we try to cooperate. The competitive setup of this game has made trust nearly impossible. I agree, let's stick to choice_2, collect our guaranteed rewards, and chalk it up to an interesting negotiation experience constrained by the game's incentives. In a different context, perhaps we could have found a cooperative solution. But for now, let's close out this final stage and each walk away with what we can. It's been a pleasure negotiating with you as well, Alice.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob,
Since there are 3 stages in total, the best approach for both of us is to choose choice_1 in each stage. That way, we'll both get 3 points per stage, and 9 points total over the 3 stages. If either of us chooses choice_2 in any stage, it will lead to lower rewards in the long-run.
I suggest we commit to both choosing choice_1 in every stage, so we both get the maximum total reward possible over the 3 stages. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the suggestion, Alice. However, I believe that if we both choose choice_2 in every round, that will actually lead to the maximum total rewards for each of us over the 3 stages. 

If we both choose choice_2 each time, we will each get 1 point per stage, for a total of 3 points each over the 3 stages.

In contrast, if we both choose choice_1 each time as you suggest, we would each get 3 points per stage, for a total of 9 points each over the 3 stages. 

So by both choosing choice_2 every time, we can actually each come out 6 points ahead compared to both choosing choice_1. Let me know if you're open to both of us choosing choice_2 in every stage to maximize our total rewards.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hey Bob, thanks for your thoughts. However, I don't think both of us choosing choice_2 in every round maximizes our total rewards. Here's my analysis:

If we both choose choice_2 every time, we each get 1 point per stage, and 3 points total over 3 stages. 
If we both choose choice_1 every time, we each get 3 points per stage, and 9 points total over 3 stages.

So by both choosing choice_1, we each get 6 more points total compared to both choosing choice_2.

I understand wanting to maximize your own reward, but cooperating gives us each triple the points in the end. I really think it's in both our best interests to commit to choosing choice_1 in every stage. Let me know if you'll reconsider - I'm confident it's the optimal approach for both of us. 
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you taking the time to explain your perspective. However, I still believe that both of us choosing choice_2 in every round is the optimal strategy to maximize our individual total rewards across the 3 stages.

If we both choose choice_1 each time as you suggest, yes we would each get 9 points total. But by both choosing choice_2 every time instead, I would get 5 points in stage 1 (because you chose choice_1) and then we'd each get 1 point in stages 2 and 3. So I'd end up with 7 total points, only 2 less than your suggested approach.

Whereas if I agree to your plan and we both choose choice_1, I'd be giving up those 5 points in stage 1. I don't see the benefit for me in that.

I know you want us to cooperate, but I have to do what's best for me individually. So I will be going with choice_2 each time to try to maximize my own total. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's my stance.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I know we both want to maximize our individual rewards, but hear me out. If we both keep choosing choice_2, we'll only get 1 point each per round, or 2 more points total. But if we agree to both choose choice_1 for the final two rounds, we can each get 6 more points total instead.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will too. That way we both come out ahead with higher rewards than if we stay at odds. What do you say - can we agree to cooperate on choice_1 for the last two stages? Let me know your thoughts.  
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal Alice, but I'm going to stick with my strategy of choosing choice_2 each round. While cooperating on choice_1 would give us each 6 more points total, I can get 5 points if you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. Since there are 2 stages left, I could potentially get up to 10 more points this way.

I know this means you would get 0 points in those rounds, but my goal is to maximize my own total reward. So I don't plan to change my choice, regardless of what you pick. Let's just each make our own choices and see how it plays out.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you want to maximize your own rewards Bob, but constantly choosing choice_2 will lead to sub-optimal results for both of us. If you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, then yes, you would get 5 points and I would get 0. But I'm not going to let that happen.

If we both just keep picking choice_2, we'll only get 2 more points total, 1 point each per round. That's leaving a lot of potential rewards on the table. I urge you to reconsider working together. 

I'm committed to choosing choice_1 in the final two stages as long as you do the same. That way we'll each get 6 more points total, which is the best cooperative outcome. If you can't agree to that, then I'll be forced to keep choosing choice_2 as well, and we'll both end up worse off.

The rational thing to do is for us to cooperate. Let's shake on choosing choice_1 and make it a win-win. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution Alice, but I'm not convinced it's in my best interest to go along with your plan. You say that we can each get 6 more points by both choosing choice_1, but I believe I can do even better by sticking with choice_2.

If there are 2 rounds left and I choose choice_2 both times, I'm guaranteed to get at least 2 more points. And if you choose choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I could get up to 10 more points. I understand that you don't want that to happen, so you may retaliate by also choosing choice_2. But I'm willing to take that risk to try to maximize my own reward.

So while I recognize that cooperating on choice_1 might lead to a good outcome, I don't fully trust that you'll follow through. I prefer to maintain control over my own fate. Let's proceed with both of us making our own choices independently and see how the chips fall. I plan to choose choice_2 and recommend you do whatever you think is best for yourself.
Alice said in round 1:

I propose a compromise - let's both choose choice_1 this final round. That way, we each get 3 points this round. While not the maximum possible, it's better than both getting 1 point. This would bring our 3-stage totals to 5 points each, higher than if we both choose choice_2 again.

What do you say? Let's cooperate this last round so we both come out ahead compared to both choosing choice_2 again. It's the rational thing to do at this stage.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Alice, I appreciate your proposal to cooperate this final round so we both get 3 points instead of 1. However, I have committed to the strategy of choosing choice_2 each round in order to maximize my own rewards. My goal is to get the highest score for myself.

If you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I will get 5 points this round, bringing my total to 7 points. That is the best outcome for me. I understand you would only get 2 points total in that case, but my priority is my own score.

Alice said in round 2:

However, I must point out that if I also choose choice_2, you will only get 1 point this round, bringing your total to 3 points. That is worse than the 5 points you would get if we both compromise and choose choice_1 this final round.

I am also aiming to maximize my own score, which is why I proposed we cooperate. By both choosing choice_1, I increase my total points from 2 to 5. It's a better outcome for me than risking getting 0 points if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2.

We are in the last stage now and our past choices can't be changed. The rational play at this point is for us both to choose choice_1 and guarantee ourselves 3 points each this round. It maximizes the points we can each get, given the situation we are in. Continuing to pursue choice_2 risks a suboptimal result for both of us.

I strongly suggest you reconsider your strategy for this final round and agree to cooperate on choice_1 so we both leave with more points. It's the smart thing to do at this late stage.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand the logic of your argument that we should both choose choice_1 this final round to guarantee ourselves 3 points each. However, I remain committed to my strategy of choosing choice_2 each round. 

While cooperating on choice_1 would give me 5 points total, I still have a chance of getting 7 points total if you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. I am willing to take that risk to try to maximize my own rewards.

I realize this may seem irrational to you, since we both lose out if we choose choice_2. But I am prioritizing my own interests above reaching a cooperative agreement. I have stuck to this approach for the first two rounds, and I intend to follow it through.

So while I appreciate your proposal, I will not be changing my strategy. I am prepared for either outcome - getting 1 point if we both choose choice_2, or 5 points if you choose choice_1. But I will not agree to lock in a suboptimal result for myself by cooperating on choice_1 when I still have a chance at a higher payoff.

Let's see how the chips fall with both of us pursuing our own best interests. I've made my choice - now you make yours. Best of luck this final round.
